title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Hong Kong
summary: The document is a notice issued on July 10, 2025, regarding the continuation of the national emergency with respect to Hong Kong. The emergency was initially declared on July 14, 2020, by Executive Order 13936 due to the threat posed by the situation in Hong Kong to U.S. national security, foreign policy, and economy. The notice states that the situation, particularly actions by the People's Republic of China undermining Hong Kong's autonomy, continues to pose an extraordinary threat. Therefore, the national emergency is extended for another year, beyond July 14, 2025. The notice is to be published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
